page.title: 06A TRADITIONAL BAKERY
page.content: There is a local bakery situated at Bathway crossroads on the southern edge of Chewton Mendip. It is a traditional family business employing three members of the family and one other. The bakery itself has one huge old oven with two main sections . A variety of breads and cakes are made, including many wholemeal types. The bakery also specialises in wedding cakes as well as traditional specialities like harvest loaves. The bread is sold in the Post Office Stores which is also run by the family. The bread is also deliverd to many homes, pubs, restaurants and hotels in the surrounding villages and hamlets. Traditionally home baked bread is obviously still very popular.
